intro: Alaticaulia neukermansii, commonly known as the Neukermans' alate-stemmed plant, is a rare and unique species native to specific regions in southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, winged stems that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its specialized morphology. Its leaves are often reduced to small scales, minimizing water loss, while its flowers are small and clustered. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
